quoteFirst: “Look!” He held it up with the face toward us. The hands stood at
quoteLast: . “The hour and the moment when it struck the floor,” he declared. “And consequently the hour and the moment when Mrs. Jeffrey fell,” finished Durbin.

quoteFirst: The train arrived at Kizil Arvat, two hundred and forty-two versts from the Caspian, at

quoteLast: a rain storm burst over the country, completely obscuring the view, and by Zero the assaulting troops were lying out ready. They had not been seen.

quoteFirst: If, after having looked at my watch between 4 and 5, I look again between 7 and 8, and find that the hour and minute-hands have then exactly changed places, it was 36 12-13 minutes past 4 when I first looked. At that time the hour-hand would be pointing to 23 1-13 minutes on the dial, and at 23 1-
quoteLast: the hour hand would be pointing to 36 12-13 minutes.
